rfc3161Timestamps.description: A list of RFC3161 signed timestamps provided by the user. This can be used when the entry has not been stored on a transparency log, or in conjunction for a stronger trust model. Clients MUST verify the hashed message in the message imprint against the signature in the bundle.

TimestampVerificationData.title:
Notes on versioning.
 The primary message ('Bundle') MUST be versioned, by populating the
 'media_type' field. Semver-ish (only major/minor versions) scheme MUST
 be used. The current version as specified by this file is:
 application/vnd.dev.sigstore.bundle+json;version=0.2
 The semantic version is thus '0.2'.
TimestampVerificationData.description: Notes on versioning. The primary message ('Bundle') MUST be versioned, by populating the 'media_type' field. Semver-ish (only major/minor versions) scheme MUST be used. The current version as specified by this file is: application/vnd.dev.sigstore.bundle+json;version=0.2 The semantic version is thus '0.2'.  Various timestamped counter signatures over the artifacts signature. Currently only RFC3161 signatures are provided. More formats may be added in the future.

signedTimestamp.description: Signed timestamp is the DER encoded TimeStampResponse. See https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3161.html#section-2.4.2

dev.sigstore.common.v1.RFC3161SignedTime.title: RFC 3161 Signed Timestamp
dev.sigstore.common.v1.RFC3161SignedTime.description: This message holds a RFC 3161 timestamp.
